intro: Orchis latifolia var. orbiculatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and tall, erect flowering stems that bear clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native range.
